summary:
The Security Council, recalling its previous resolutions on Lebanon, particularly resolutions 425 (1978), 1701 (2006), and 2004 (2011), and the statements of its President on the situation in Lebanon, 
Decides to extend the mandate of UNIFIL for a period of one year, until 31 August 2013, without amendment, 
Reiterating its support for Lebanon's territorial integrity, sovereignty, and political independence, 
Reaffirming its commitment to the full implementation of resolution 1701 (2006), 
Calling upon all parties to strengthen efforts to implement resolution 1701 (2006) without delay, 
Expressing concern at violations of resolution 1701 (2006), 
Welcoming the role of the tripartite mechanism and UNIFIL's efforts to develop liaison and coordination arrangements, 
Emphasizing the importance of complying with the prohibition on arms sales and supply, 
Recalling the importance of respecting the Blue Line, 
Condemning the terrorist attack against UNIFIL peacekeepers on 9 December 2011, 
Commending UNIFIL's personnel and expressing appreciation to contributing Member States, 
Recalling the request from the Government of Lebanon to deploy an international force, 
Welcoming the Secretary-General's efforts to review peacekeeping operations, 
Expressing support for the strategic priorities and recommendations identified by the Secretary-General, 
Calling upon Member States to assist the Lebanese Armed Forces, 
Determining that the situation in Lebanon continues to threaten international peace and security, 
1. Decides to extend the mandate of UNIFIL until 31 August 2013; 
2. Commends UNIFIL's positive role and welcomes cooperation between UNIFIL and the Lebanese Armed Forces; 
3. Welcomes the engagement of UNIFIL and the Lebanese Armed Forces in the Strategic dialogue.
Here is a summarized version of the Security Council document:

The Security Council:

3. Authorizes assistance to the Lebanese Armed Forces to enable it to fulfil its mandated tasks under resolution 1701 (2006);

4. Calls for respect for the cessation of hostilities, prevention of Blue Line violations, and cooperation with the UN and UNIFIL;

5. Condemns terrorist attacks against UNIFIL, urges respect for its safety and freedom of movement, and calls for cooperation between UNIFIL and the Lebanese Armed Forces;

6. Urges parties to cooperate towards a permanent ceasefire and long-term solution as envisioned in resolution 1701 (2006);
